newsitem.title: THAILAND: Mitsui, NEC win Thai contract.
newsitem.headline: Mitsui, NEC win Thai contract.

text.p: Mitsui and Co Ltd and NEC Corp said on Monday they jointly received an order from TelecomAsia Corp to set up a personal handyphone system (PHS) in Thailand.
The companies said in a statement the five-year contract includes construction and supply of the system that can handle a maximum of one million subscribers.

Under the first phase, worth about 20 billion yen, the companies will begin construction this year and install the system in a 1,500 square km area in Bangkok. It will be done with the support of NTT Central Personal Communications Network Inc, a PHS operator in Japan.
Mitsui is the main contractor and NEC is the supplier of the system, the statement said.
TelecomAsia is a private telephone company operating 2.6 million lines of public telephone service in the Bangkok area.
The company is planning to offer an additional telephone service called personal cordless telephone. Japan's PHS has successfully been used for this service.
The PHS service, begun in Japan in July last year, has more than four million subscibers, the statement said.
It said the Japanese government, telecommunication operators and manufacturers are promoting the system outside Japan to make PHS a standard for personal communication systems around the world.
